turns.content: how do you make bosnian cevapi

To make Bosnian cevapi, you will need the following ingredients:

* 500 g of minced meat (usually a combination of beef, lamb, and pork)
* 1 onion, finely chopped
* 2 cloves of garlic, minced
* 1 teaspoon of salt
* 1/2 teaspoon of black pepper
* 1/2 teaspoon of ground paprika
* 1/4 teaspoon of cayenne pepper
* 1/4 teaspoon of ground cumin
* 1/4 teaspoon of baking soda
* 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil

Mix the minced meat, onion, garlic, salt, black pepper, paprika, cayenne pepper, cumin, and baking soda in a bowl until well combined. Cover the mixture and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.

To shape the cevapi, wet your hands with water and take small handfuls of the meat mixture. Shape into long, thin cylinders, about the thickness of your finger.

Heat the vegetable oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. When the oil is hot, add the cevapi and cook for about 5 minutes on each side, or until they are nicely browned and cooked through.

Serve the cevapi hot with a side of onions, sour cream, and/or ajvar (a roasted red pepper sauce). Enjoy!
how do you make vege sarma

To make vege sarma, you will need the following ingredients:

* 1 cup of long-grain rice
* 1/4 cup of vegetable oil
* 1 onion, finely chopped
* 1 red bell pepper, seeded and finely chopped
* 1 carrot, peeled and grated
* 1/2 cup of frozen peas
* 1/2 cup of canned corn
* 1/2 cup of canned chickpeas
* 2 cloves of garlic, minced
* 2 teaspoons of tomato paste
* 1 teaspoon of sweet paprika
* 1/2 teaspoon of salt
* 1/4 teaspoon of black pepper
* 1/4 teaspoon of cayenne pepper
* 1/4 teaspoon of ground cumin
* 2 cups of vegetable broth
* 1/2 cup of chopped fresh parsley
* 1/2 cup of chopped fresh dill
* 1/2 cup of chopped fresh mint
* 1/2 cup of chopped fresh cilantro
* 1/4 cup of chopped fresh basil
* 1 tablespoon of fresh lemon juice
* 16 grape leaves (fresh or jarred)
* 1/4 cup of plain yogurt, for serving

Start by cooking the rice according to the package instructions.

While the rice is cooking, heat the vegetable oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion, bell pepper, carrot, peas, corn, chickpeas, garlic, tomato paste, paprika, salt, black pepper, cayenne pepper, and cumin. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender, about 10 minutes.

Stir in the cooked rice, vegetable broth, parsley, dill, mint, cilantro, basil, and lemon juice. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer, covered, for 10 minutes.

To assemble the sarma, lay a grape leaf on a flat surface, with the stem end facing you. Place a tablespoon of the rice mixture in the center of the leaf. Fold the stem end over the filling, then fold in the sides and roll up the leaf to form a neat package. Repeat with the remaining grape leaves and filling.

Arrange the sarma in a single layer in a large saucepan. Pour in enough water to cover the sarma and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 20 minutes, or until the grape leaves are tender and the filling is heated through.

Serve the sarma hot with a dollop of yogurt on top. Enjoy!
